alert.note: Alert for Harding County; Quay County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN HARDING, NORTHEASTERN QUAY AND SOUTHERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM MDT... At 920 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Bueyeros, or 16 miles east of Mosquero, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rosebud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Harding County; Quay County; Union County
